requirements.description:
The Senior Backend Engineer will be responsible for:

  • Writing robust, performant, production quality code and tests
  • Identifying and applying appropriate design patterns and practices
  • Providing a leading contribution to the design and code review processes
  • Assisting delivery leadership with work planning and estimations
  • Support the testing and deployment of the platform both internally and externally
  • Working with project governance to ensure successful product delivery
  • Fostering a positive, respectful, and delivery focused culture for the team.


Essential requirements:

  • A graduate degree in computer science or related field, or equivalent industry experience
  • Excellent software engineering skills, including 10+ years of experience delivering production-grade software in Java  
  • Production experience designing and implementing communication-intensive networked systems, including a strong understanding of communication workloads and security in this context.
  • Prior product development experience, including work delivering research and development projects to production.
  • Knowledge of web API design best practices and experience with modern API tools and platforms.
  • Knowledge of enterprise integration patterns and practices and experience with integration and messaging platforms
  • Strong understanding of SQL and experience with relational database systems
  • Interpersonal skills and emotional intelligence when working in a team

requirements.description: The Solution Architect will work within the ROBUST Program to deliver fit for purpose Solution Design Documents. This would include but not limited to working within a multidisciplinary team of Business Analysts, Program Architects, Project and Program Managers and Business Stakeholders. A key focus area for this role will be the Bureau's Disaster Recovery project. The successful candidate must have +10 years of experience establishing, designing, or managing recovery capability within the IT infrastructure environment for major organisations. Their experience will include developing DR/BCP framework, policy, plans and procedures, as well as undertaking business impact assessment, design review, process analysis, and risk assessment. The candidate will act as an ongoing DR subject matter expert and will assist with scoping, designing, testing, training, and transformation activities within the Disaster Recovery project and the broader Bureau as a whole. In most cases they would capture the knowledge of a Technical Architect / SME (Subject Matter Expert) and or Vendor to assist a project in a delivered outcome.  The Solution Architect is expected to work closely with other Program Architects and Vendors and derive Solution and Detailed Design outcomes for a variety of other IT Infrastructure, System and Service based solutions. Please refer to the Statement of Requirements for full details. No Market Briefing is to be held for this opportunity. Select agencies invited to participate in this opportunity. No further invitations will be extended to additional agencies.

requirements.description:
The request seeks to engage an experienced service provider who has the capability to provide:

Introduction

The Department of Defence with an enterprise-wide video based/digital online learning platform.

The video based/digital online learning platform needs to help all staff gain new skills and advance their professional careers. The aim is to provide just-in-time learning that features instructional content relevant to employee’s professional and personal interests and goals. Requirement

The enterprise wide video based/digital online learning platform for whole of Defence will:

  1. Provide unlimited access for users covering a wide range of topics such as leadership, business, creative skills and technology.
  2. Offer personalised recommendations and explore the most in-demand skills/reward based on each personal experience.
  3. Provide learning content by industry expert instructors, learn from industry leaders and provide a hands on approach to learning.
  4. Provide access to courses anywhere anytime as a convenient approach to learning, accessible from any desktop or mobile device.
  5. Offer self-paced learning with bite sized video content.
  6. Provide additional resources for each topic to reinforce new knowledge with quizzes and exercise files with the reward of certifications on completion of course.
  7. As required the seller (and online learning platform) will provide customised playlists on specific subject matters as requested by Defence.
  8. Provide function/service where individual Defence learners can download their learning history from the online platform and mobile application.

data.label: Location of work
data.value: ACT, NSW, NT, QLD, SA, TAS, VIC, WA, Offsite

data.label: Working arrangements
data.value: Buyer has not provided these details

essential.desc: The successful tender/seller will need to ensure compatibility with the Defence Protected Network. The Defence Protected Network (Workstation OS: Windows 10, Version 1703, OS Build 15063.1563) utilises three internet web browsers listed below with version numbers. Microsoft Edge: Version 40.15063.674.0 Internet Explorer, Version: 11.1563.15063.0 Google Chrome, Version: 66.0.3359.181 Other platforms such as the learner’s personal devices must also be supported within the service requirement.

The provision of an online video/digital learning platform via the Defence Protected Network, Australia wide WEF 29 March 2023. Work in consultation with Defence to facilitate learning workshops such as Lunch n Learn and Information sessions aimed at non-users and users at various Defence sites across the country. Agreed dates will be discussed between Defence and seller as required. Work with Defence Learning Branch to support to the Learn eXcel Perform (LXP) Project pilot, expected to run from December 2022 to May 2023. Agreed dates and locations will be discussed between Defence and seller as required.

The enterprise wide video based/digital learning platform will need to meet the requirements of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) standard, WCAG 2.0 AA, in support of accessibility requirements of all learners within Defence.

Security Requirements: ● The Seller is to ensure the handling of personal information is in accordance with the provisions of the Privacy Act 1988 (Commonwealth) ● The seller will be escorted and support by Defence APS staff while on Defence premises.

requirements.description:
VET Data Streamlining – 1x Test Manager

DEWR is leading the development of a new vocational education and training (VET) data collection and reporting system. The VET Data Streamlining (VDS) program will transform the national VET data sector to increase the timeliness and quality of data collection and use. DEWR is working with partner state and territory governments and the National Centre for Vocational Education Research (NCVER) to deliver this initiative through several strands of work over the new few years.

We are looking for a Test Manager who is a practitioner with experience in:

  • Working with a vendor to develop a test strategy, test plans
  • Quality assurance of test artefacts produced by a vendor
  • Leading the management and resolution of test defects
  • Leading and supporting business users in UAT and the use of Microsoft Azure products to manage test activities
  • Leading the engagement with key internal and external stakeholders as required to develop a test strategy, test plans and the resolution of defects
  • Participate in data migration and test data preparation activities as required

***Please note we have included a new submission guide which must be completed and attached to your submission. Failure to complete this guide will result in disqualifying your submission***

requirements.description:
The Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water (DCCEEW) is a new department that has been established to deliver on the Government’s climate change and energy agenda and protect Australia’s environment and water resources.


The department is seeking experienced Senior Business Analysts to work on the one or more departmental analysis and development projects, in a fast-paced dynamic environment.


Refer to the requirements summary for specific details of the RFQ.


To be successful in the role requires you to have a strong work ethic including taking ownership and initiative, providing professional expertise, and a high level of productivity. You must have suitable qualifications or training in business analysis techniques and at least 3 years’ experience working as a business analyst. 


To be eligible, applicants MUST be an Australian Citizen. Work eligibility is checked as part of the recruitment process. Preferred /short listed candidates will be required to complete pre-employment screening, including a national police check and misconduct screening.


Rates are not to be included in the submitted CV. Failure to adhere to this will result in the application not being compliant and therefore will not be assessed.


Please note that the second criteria should be as follows:

Describe your experience in producing high quality, concise, easy to read and relevant analysis, design, technical specifications, or user research documentation. What kinds of documentation or artefacts have you created and how were they received by your stakeholders?

Weighting 50%.

data.label: Working arrangements
data.value: Positions are based in our Canberra offices. Whilst the department’s current Working Away from the Office (WAFO) policy encourages staff to work in the office a minimum of 40% of the time (such as 2 days per week or 4 days per fortnight), the team requirements are that people work in the office 60% of the time or 3 days a week. Variations can be discussed with the director however, any requests for any less than 40% in the office needs to be supported by the director and approved by the CIO. Due to the nature of some projects, there are some positions where working from home will not be available.

requirements.description:
The request seeks to engage an experienced service provider who has the capability to provide:

Introduction

The Department of Defence with an enterprise-wide video based/digital online learning platform.

The video based/digital online learning platform needs to help all staff gain new skills and advance their professional careers. The aim is to provide just-in-time learning that features instructional content relevant to employee’s professional and personal interests and goals. Requirement

The enterprise wide video based/digital online learning platform for whole of Defence will:

  1. Provide unlimited access for users covering a wide range of topics such as leadership, business, creative skills and technology.
  2. Offer personalised recommendations and explore the most in-demand skills/reward based on each personal experience.
  3. Provide learning content by industry expert instructors, learn from industry leaders and provide a hands on approach to learning.
  4. Provide access to courses anywhere anytime as a convenient approach to learning, accessible from any desktop or mobile device.
  5. Offer self-paced learning with bite sized video content.
  6. Provide additional resources for each topic to reinforce new knowledge with quizzes and exercise files with the reward of certifications on completion of course.
  7. As required the seller (and online learning platform) will provide customised playlists on specific subject matters as requested by Defence.
  8. Provide function/service where individual Defence learners can download their learning history from the online platform and mobile application.

requirements.description:
Attorney-General's Department requires an experienced Organisational Change Manager

The Organisational Change Manager will work closely with the Program Manager to manage the business and APS change activities to ensure effective delivery of the business and APS capability and enable optimal realisation of desired, measurable benefits.


The Organisational Change Manager will apply comprehensive knowledge of principles, practices and theories as they relate to effective project and change management, with particular regard to PRINCE2, Agile and PROSCI methodologies.


The Organisational Change Manager will develop Change Management Plans and relevant change artefacts to ensure the best outcomes for the relevant stakeholders; covering holistic approach and using five change management levers to drive successful change i.e. communications plan, sponsor roadmap, coaching plan, training plan and resistance management plan.


The Organisational Change manager will lead, manage and develop the strategy, implementation and evaluation of the project’s benefit management plan and roadmap to ensure that the benefits are agreed with the Benefit Owner, and their realisation is monitored progress against the milestones

As part of this role the successful candidate will be required to deliver the following:

  • Develop and deliver a Change management strategy and plan for the project.
  • Develop and deliver a communication management strategy and plan for the project.
  • Work as a member of project team to execute the agreed plan across all project stakeholders, where the plan will include (but is not limited to):
    • communications for the projects,
    • stakeholder management,
    • user engagement and participation.
    • implementation of the future system,
    • user training,
    • support,
    • business process improvement.
  • Develop and deliver a change management plan structure and approach (including templates) that will assist stakeholders to subsequently develop their own internal change management plans for the project outputs. This plan will require clear role and responsibilities definition between the stakeholders and the project(s).
  • Provide weekly reports to the nominated manager / executive.
  • Report to and attend project meetings as required including project boards or user advisory groups.

The Department is seeking the services of a highly experienced Security Solution Architect who will be responsible for forming, developing and documenting fit for purpose designs for Cyber Hub capabilities based on requirements. This includes both cyber specific and technology specific design elements. They will also participate in technical requirements collection, collaborate with technical subject matter experts on design, resolve design challenges and work effectively with Cyber Hub clients.


The Specified Personnel will be responsible for providing the following deliverables including but not limited to:

  • Forming, developing and documenting quality designs for cyber hub capabilities based on requirements;
  • Collecting and formulating the technical requirements for the cyber hub capabilities;
  • Producing and refining cyber hub patterns for use by technology teams and clients;
  • Advising and guiding technology teams on detailed design;
  • Ensuring stakeholders are engaged and consulted and any issues are resolved;
  • Participating in the client discovery exercise;
  • Working under the direction of the Cyber Lead Domain architect as it relates to solution design, or to the Cyber Hub security architect.


Specified Personnel will be expected to transfer skills and knowledge to departmental staff and ensure appropriate documentation is stored in accordance with the Department’s recordkeeping policy and practices.


The Specified Personnel will also be responsible for producing the following deliverables, including but not limited to:

  • Cyber Hub designs and supporting artefacts;
  • Architectural decisions;
  • Technical requirements specification.

Through the application of modern digital technology, VDS will increase the availability, timeliness, and relevance of VET data for all users. The Australian Government is working with state and territory governments and the NCVER to implement the VDS program over three years. 

Working in the Program Management Office (PMO) on the VET Data Streamlining Program the team is seeking a commercial procurement and contract management advisor to assist with the complex contracts and procurements within the branch.
